question: Who became the youngest Indian cricketer to score a half-century in international cricket?
explanation: Fifteen-year-old Shafali Verma became the youngest Indian cricketer to score a half-century in international cricket surpassing Sachin Tendulkarâ€™s 30-year-old record. Shafali achieved the feat at 15 years and 285 days, surpassing batting legend Tendulkar, who had notched up his maiden Test fifty at 16 years and 214 days.
